revised_title: Investigations of Alternating Fields and Low Temperatures in Iron Ammonium Alum
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on iron ammonium alum in alternating fields at very low temperatures to study the thermal energy changes due to the emission and absorption of radioactive radiations. They found that the irreversible heating in the substance increased as the temperature decreased and was proportional to the square of the applied amplitude and the frequency of the alternating current. The results provide insights into the behavior of magnetic materials and the potential for improving temperature measurement methods.
